title: 8 supports are played in 70% of high tier ranked games
body:
Also Thresh is almost twice as popular as the second most picked support

http://champion.gg/statistics/#?roleSort=Support&sortBy=general.playPercent&order=descend

EDIT: Let me be clear: this isn't a call to nerf Thresh, it's a call to promote more diversity in the role.

Okay, wait.

How can it be that Thresh take someone who's actually good at him, but Blitz is faceroll?

Because Thresh has spells that have multiple uses.
As Blitzcrank, you W (speedboost to reposition), Q (pull), E (knock-up), R (AoE Silence). There's only one possible combo.

As Thresh, when you hook someone, you have to make a choice whether to go in or not. If you choose to go in, you can either Flay the target towards your team and/or box the enemy. You can spam his ult because it's on an actual cooldown. You can flay for engage and disengage, you can use lantern to engage or disengage, and you can use the box to engage or disengage. His kit is more complex than Blitzcrank.

(tbh, anyone's kit is more complex than blitzcrank)
No, you could also W(Charge into the Enemy) E, R, And then Q them as they try to run away

Big difference between low complexity and faceroll.  

You can focus on the lack of decision points in Blitz's kit, but you can also turn it around and point out how Thresh has more fallback options, how it might be "faceroll" because Thresh can choose not to take a hook, where Blitz doesn't get that choice.

Thresh is one of the most popular champions in the game because he can fit well into and against any team comp. He works well with pretty much every ADC since he has so much disengage, engage, and peel, and even if he or his team is behind he has enough utility to remain extremely relevant. Even if you dodge all of his hooks, the one time your carry doesn't, they can instantly die.

Supports like Sona, Nami, Zilean, and Bard may need buffs, but they should not be as overloaded as Thresh is. He may not be the most overpowered champion in the game, but is definitely overloaded and needs a thing or two from his kit removed even if It's just nerfing his damage, which he actually does have a lot of as well.

Yet he got heavy nerfs over and over again. His hook damage went down along with the flay active damage and AD ratio on his flay AA. His mana costs went up. His lantern shield got about a 10% increase but made only work on 2 people. His ult went from 1 wall 100% damage and 4 walls 50% damage to 1 wall 100% damage. Talk about favored by Riot am i rite? They have even said his problem is he has massive utility to bring to the table and the only way you can remove that is by completely reworking him and guess what that means. He will just turn up stronger because his ult is in a really bad state against most champs (99% slow is nice and all but most champs use dashes and such now.

But oh its perfectly okay to have Morgana or Leona in bot lane being almost nearly as bad as him because they aren't Thresh. Leona is the reason Thresh is allowed to be as strong as he is. She has so much stupid stick potential that people like Thresh have to be able to peel and infinite CC (honestly her ult range needs to be dropped, its a fucking sniper CC ability with low CD on a tank meant to stick to people for years). And Morgana just does well because she has a 100% ratio on her Q which also roots for 3s and a spell shield that you can't break as long as you don't have significant magic damage. Braum I am fine with being strong because he has his risks and they keep purposely making him weaker at engaging (because he is meant to peel) and often dies for saving his team due to the CC absorption.

And no I do not hate any of these champs. But when people start and try and complain about their supports not being viable I have to be honest and point out where the problems stem from. I do not hate any of these champs, but they all pose problems to balance save Braum (he does his role and he does it well and doesn't do other roles that well).

However I am trying to be realistic about it. Just think about it, regardless of how balanced the game might be our idealogy as human beings is to classify, judge and label everything we meet and experience.

This is mostly why we create tier lists and such. This is also why riot is constantly changing the game to ensure that the meta changes to avoid stagnation and to keep us on our toes.

The reason we complain is that we want change of pace and not necessarily balance, but we want underdog surprises and we want the top dogs to be pegged down when they have been dominate for so long.

Rock, Paper and Scissor is a near perfect balanced game from a pure design standpoint, but your have outward bias such as inexperienced males always throwing rock first for instance.

Here is the problem.

Thresh is an overloaded support with many different functions. Thresh can be used to engage or to peel and CC.

Other supports like Janna, Leona or Annie excel greatly at one of these areas.

So if you're considering playing a support, Thresh fits more categories, so he's "picked" more. It's like he can be picked twice, by peelers and engagers.

Support definitely is the role that I feel needs the most attention yet seems to fly under the radar as to the core issues. Riot has made some strides to help with some issues (gold income, item choices), but have missed the biggest issue, lack of diversity in play style. Not much lack of diversity but the role is restrictive in allowing those champions to really push their kits to the level.

What makes it worse is that some supports clearly have so much more to offer to the role than others. That's the problem. How the role is played and what is expected of it needs some consideration. We need to ask ourselves what does it actually mean to be "Support"? Until we revise that, there will never be much room for diversity in it.
